name: The Imperial Hawaii Resort at Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I booked 7 nights at the Imperial through our timeshare.
reviews.title: Location Main Reason to Stay at Imperial

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a one-bedroom, two-bathroom suite on the second to top floor of the Imperial. We certainly couldn't complain about the size of the suite--it was spacious, and in addition to the bedroom and 2 baths, had a kitchenette (a trip to the market saved us some money on food), living room and dining room area. The room was relatively clean and the bed was comfortable. The furniture is defintely outdated and a bit tacky if you care about those things. We did not.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

reviews.text: We had a view of the ocean, which was partially obscured by a couple of other high-rise hotels in the area. The view was still pretty nice.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Guests get access to the owners lounge which has internet access and there is a pool on the roof. The pool scene was definitely NOT happening and it was largely deserted. But since you're in Hawaii, why go to the rooftop pool, right? The hotel allows you to check out beach towels which was great.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One complaint I have is that the housekeepers come to your room early. And in some instances, they kept knocking even though we had the Do Not Disturb sign up. Another complaint is that there is no parking structure or lot. It is all valet, which means you get charged a daily valet fee.
reviews.title: Loved the Location

likes.liked: — It was comfortable and the people were so friendly, a casual great get-a-way!

reviews.text: Resort in great location to beach and shopping. Room was above average. Accomodtions were not comparable to property in Orlando but it was clean and served it's purpose. Staff were ALL friendly and helpful. Stayed in 1 bedroom 2 bath with Murphy bed and pullout couch. Guest said the Murphy was comfortable. Decent work out facility. Highly reccommend. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Well pleased

likes.disliked: — lighting in bathroom poor. Would be convienent if rooms were internet accessible

reviews.text: This was an alternative to the Fairfield property I reviewed earlier. It is also part of a timeshare program. If you overlook the dated decor, this place is very good. As you can see from the pictures, it had the Hawaiian floral printed cushions on white rattan. I was in a 1 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit.
reviews.title: Friendly, Efficient, and Convenient

likes.disliked: — The decor could use some updating.

reviews.text: Pluses ~
reviews.title: Incredible location at an Afforadable Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower pressure was great and there was always hot water. The kitchenette had a microwave, coffee maker, toaster, stove, and dishwasher. There was plenty of utensils, plates, pots, etc. There was a small but adequate lanai, an iron and board, and hairdryers in both bathrooms.
reviews.title: Great Location and Service
Soon, it will be better
reviews.text: The best thing was the pull-down bed. It was very comfortable and unlike those worn out sofa-sleepers.

We stayed at this nice little hotel on Lewers street. Great service -we were allowed to check in early and had excellent service from the front desk and valet all week. They gave us great tips on restaruants and had even clipped coupons saving us a ton of money. Valet is extreemily promt almost too fast. We received every wake up call we asked for. The beds are comfy and it is nice to have a small kitchen and fridge. We stayed in a Palm unit with our 3 kids and felt the space was more than adequate and the extra bathroom makes a huge difference. Love the lanai's (Balcanies). We had 3 families staying in different units all traveling together and everyone had an excellent stay. Some units are more up to date than others but we spent most of our time at the various beaches and other activities out side the hotel-it's not the ritz, but it is great. It is a perfect base camp and we woke well rested every morning ready for adventure. The new shops and restaruants on Lewers street make this one of the best locations in waikiki. You have everything you need with in a few strides...literally. The beach is 3 minutes or less...enjoy all Waikiki has to offer from this perfect location! Nice pool and hot tub upstairs-the pool was a little chilly. Leave your beach towels at home you can check them out from the hotel...nice touch. Get with Kona for your island adventure activities she is the best! Small things like leaky shower nob easily overlooked.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay! Spacious rooms and a friendly staff. The parking is a bit expensive at $25 a day but other than that everything was great. It is very close to the beach and to many restuarant, shops, etc.
reviews.title: Loved the Imperial!

reviews.text: The location for the Imperial was a definite plus, close to the beach, close to the stores and shops, and close to other key locations. The hotel facilities were quite comfortable and the staff had a very laid back attitude. They were more then willing to accomodate any needs we had. The tours offered were well worth it and not too costly. They have a cute little exercise room, but I found the pool area to be too small as well as the pool. It can get a bit cramped there. All in all, a nice and comfortable stay.
reviews.title: comfortable and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Imperial at Waikiki in late June of 2006, using his sister's time share. We stayed in a one bedroom, two bathroom suite on the 19th floor with a spectacular view. The accomodations were a little outdated, but very clean. For the price and location though, you can't beat it (we paid $15 a day for valet car service and room taxes). The Imperial is right across the street from the beach! The furniture was reminiscent of "The Golden Girls" and the carpet was a bright green, but you're in Waikiki!... it's supposed to be tropical and cheesy. The kitchenette was well stocked and sufficient for 2-4 people. We went to the market and bought food and snacks for the week. The A/C worked well, and the water pressure in the bathrooms was good. The lanai was small, but sufficient with 2 chairs and small table and ashtray. The view was great! We could see the beautiful Halekulani across the street, and a patch of the ocean beyond.
reviews.title: Great Waikiki Time Share!

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the valets on the ground floor. We never waited more than 5 minutes for our car, and they were great with directions and maps. The elevators were in high demand, and we did wait a little while to get up to our room or down to the lobby, but nothing ridiculous.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever!!!!!!

reviews.text: We got a reservation over Memorial day week as a timeshare exchange. I read in previous reviews that if you are a timeshare owner, you get better treatment. It doesnt hold true (at least for us). I went in with a positive attitude about this place and considered all the nice reviews posted on this site. I requested a high floor in advance and the lady I spoke to was very nice and said they'll do everything to try and accommodate our request. We were assigned a PALM unit on the 9th floor. I said to myself, well this isnt a high floor but I didnt say anything. My heart sank as soon as we opened the room. The room was not only very outdated, it smelled outdated too. Our room was on the back of the building which gave us a nice view of the back of the adjacent hotel and the parking lot next door. Needless to say, it was dark and gloomy. We immediately called the front desk to try and see if we can get a better room but the receptionist was not helpful. He told us that they are fully booked and that there is nothing they can do about it. They said to try and call again in the morning. I tried to not let it ruin our vacation so we immediately unpacked and started heading out to the beach. WHen we returned later in the evening and were getting ready for bed. I pulled out the murphy bed from the wall so my 5 year old can sleep on it. As soon as I did, the dust came flying out of the wall, when you peek in the space between where the bed was and the wall, it seemed like no one cleaned it for ages. The dust was very thick. Since we were so tired, we made our best to tough it out and get a good night rest. For the next couple of days, we pretty much just stayed out of the room, only to go back and sleep. On our third day, my husband went down to the front desk to see if they can change our room but the receptionist was again unrelenting, he said he cannot do anything. My husband asked if there's anyone he can talk to, it just so happened that the manager was walking by, he then explained the situation and he immediately resolved the problem. We got a KOA room on the 15th floor. I found it to be cleaner, brighter and much more roomier. It didn't matter to us that both showers didnt have enough hot water pressure (almost like a trickle) so we took semi cold showers until the hot water started running like normal again towards the end of our trip. Just as I was about to say, this place is not too bad, another incident happened. We came back to our room after spending time on the beach and found that the door was left wide open. It looked like someone fixed the beds but forgot to clean the rest of the place. The garbage was not picked up nor were our towels and toiletries re- stocked. They just made the beds and left. (Remember, if you're checking in using timeshare, you only get the room cleaned once a week). After checking the whole place, we found that nothing was missing (thankfully) but we called immediately and security was sent to our room and had our door re keyed. The hotel has apologized but it really just wasnt acceptable for us. The only perks I can agree to is that the location is very good. You're within walking distance of good restaurants and shops. Valet service was great and friendly, giving us good directions all the time. They have a good selection of DVD's in the lobby that you can rent for $3.00. ABC store is conveniently accessible downstairs. Other than this, I can't think of anything else that's nice about it. The hotel pool was small and looked like an oversized bath tub (about half the size of a normal pool and I'm not exaggerating). You're better off swimming in the warm, beautiful beaches. Hopefully, other travelers will have a much better experience (and better room) than what we had. Unfortunately, our experience is such that we probably won't come back here again unless they do some much needed work on their hotel.
reviews.title: It was doable

likes.liked: — convenient location close to shops and restaurants

reviews.text: We just returned home from a wonderful vacation in Hawaii (Oahu). We (4) of us, my husband ,our daughter ,her girlfriend and myself,staying at the Imperial Waikiki. Timeshare trade for the Hale unit, 2 bedroom 2 bath.
reviews.title: Imperial--Old Hawaiian Friendliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I honestly will tell you what a great choice we made. The unit was on the 22nd floor with a wonderful view of the ocean from each room. If you don't happen to get a room with a view don't worry. They have an owners lounge (26th floor) which has everything. Offering a full kitchen for use, pool table, computers,a big screen television to enjoy . Lots of sofas and chairs for all. ....but also that fabulous view. We watched the fireworks go off Friday eve. over the Hilton Hawaiian Lagoon from the lounge. Also on the 27th floor is the pool and hot tub with great views also. We met timeshare owners of the Imperial owning for 30 years now. They return every year they said. 4 lovely elderly folks.This was the first year they recall the pool being kept heated and warm at 84 degrees. We never used the pool tho. with the beach a block away.
reviews.title: What a nice suprise!

likes.liked: — One block from the beach, close to everything in Waikiki

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We all enjoyed ourselves, the location is perfect! The girls (early 20's) partied every night til 4 am. at the clubs very close by. The Beachwalk is very upscale, fine dining a walk across the street, or other choices up the block. You'll have to stay there to appreciate the location without paying 5 star rates! The famous Pink Royal Hawaiian is 1 block up.We all enjoyed their Luau. Trumps new Tower (Condos) going up presently is a half block away. If that doesn't speak for itself on location.
reviews.title: Wonderful

aka: The Imperial Hawaii Resort At Waikiki Hotel
